trans-unit.source: Summary
trans-unit.target: Summary

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal to create rules that transform input claims into output claims.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal to create rules that transform input claims into output claims.

trans-unit.target: Contents

trans-unit.source: Objectives
trans-unit.target: Objectives

trans-unit.source: Become familiar with the Access Control Management Portal section related to claims transformation rules.
trans-unit.target: Become familiar with the Access Control Management Portal section related to claims transformation rules.

trans-unit.source: Create basic rules.
trans-unit.target: Create basic rules.

trans-unit.source: Create advanced rules.
trans-unit.target: Create advanced rules.

trans-unit.source: Create rules based on identity provider claims.
trans-unit.target: Create rules based on identity provider claims.

trans-unit.source: Create rules based on <token>secondref_acs</token> claims.
trans-unit.target: Create rules based on <token>secondref_acs</token> claims.

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Claim rules describe the logic for transforming <token>secondref_acs</token> input claims into output claims.
trans-unit.target: Claim rules describe the logic for transforming <token>secondref_acs</token> input claims into output claims.

trans-unit.source: Rules are contained in rule groups that are associated with relying party applications.
trans-unit.target: Rules are contained in rule groups that are associated with relying party applications.

trans-unit.source: The rules are executed whenever a token is issued to <token>secondref_acs</token> for the relying party application.
trans-unit.target: The rules are executed whenever a token is issued to <token>secondref_acs</token> for the relying party application.

trans-unit.source: If a rule group does not contain any rules, <token>secondref_acs</token> does not issue tokens to the relying party application.
trans-unit.target: If a rule group does not contain any rules, <token>secondref_acs</token> does not issue tokens to the relying party application.

trans-unit.source: Summary of Steps
trans-unit.target: Summary of Steps

trans-unit.source: To create rules for token claims transformation, use the following steps.
trans-unit.target: To create rules for token claims transformation, use the following steps.

trans-unit.source: Note that some of the steps are optional in some scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Note that some of the steps are optional in some scenarios.

trans-unit.source: Step 1 – Navigate to the Rule Groups Page of the Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Step 1 – Navigate to the Rule Groups Page of the Management Portal

trans-unit.source: Step 2 – Auto-Generate New Rules
trans-unit.target: Step 2 – Auto-Generate New Rules

trans-unit.source: Step 3 – Create Pass-Through Rules
trans-unit.target: Step 3 – Create Pass-Through Rules

trans-unit.source: Step 4 – Create Advanced Transformation Rules
trans-unit.target: Step 4 – Create Advanced Transformation Rules

trans-unit.source: Step 5 – Review the Available Rule Groups
trans-unit.target: Step 5 – Review the Available Rule Groups

trans-unit.source: Step 6 – Configure the Relying Party to Use for Specific Rule Groups
trans-unit.target: Step 6 – Configure the Relying Party to Use for Specific Rule Groups

trans-unit.source: Step 1 – Navigate to the Rule Groups Page of the Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Step 1 – Navigate to the Rule Groups Page of the Management Portal

trans-unit.source: This step shows you how to navigate to the <ui>Rule Groups</ui> page of the Management Portal where rules are created and added to the rule groups.
trans-unit.target: This step shows you how to navigate to the <ui>Rule Groups</ui> page of the Management Portal where rules are created and added to the rule groups.

trans-unit.source: To navigate to the Rule Groups page of the Management Portal
trans-unit.target: To navigate to the Rule Groups page of the Management Portal

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Access Control Service</ui> page, click <ui>Rule groups</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Access Control Service</ui> page, click <ui>Rule groups</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Step 2 – Auto-Generate New Rules
trans-unit.target: Step 2 – Auto-Generate New Rules

trans-unit.source: This step shows you how to generate basic default rules.
trans-unit.target: This step shows you how to generate basic default rules.

trans-unit.source: To auto-generate basic rules
trans-unit.target: To auto-generate basic rules

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Rule groups</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Rule groups</ui>.

trans-unit.source: To create a new rule group, on the <ui>Rule Groups</ui> page, click <ui>Add</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To create a new rule group, on the <ui>Rule Groups</ui> page, click <ui>Add</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Type a name for the new rule group, and then click <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Type a name for the new rule group, and then click <ui>Save</ui>.

trans-unit.source: To auto-generate basic rules, click <ui>Generate rules</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To auto-generate basic rules, click <ui>Generate rules</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Generate rules</ui> page, specify the identity provider in the check box next to the rule you want to generate, and then click <ui>Generate</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Generate rules</ui> page, specify the identity provider in the check box next to the rule you want to generate, and then click <ui>Generate</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Review the automatically generated rules.
trans-unit.target: Review the automatically generated rules.

trans-unit.source: For example, the rules that are generated automatically for Google and <token>ms_acct</token>would look similar to the results in the following table.)
trans-unit.target: For example, the rules that are generated automatically for Google and <token>ms_acct</token>would look similar to the results in the following table.)

trans-unit.source: If the identity provider appears, click <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: If the identity provider appears, click <ui>Save</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Output claim
trans-unit.target: Output claim

trans-unit.target: Claim issuer

trans-unit.target: Rule description

trans-unit.target: Pass-through "name" claim from Google as "name"

trans-unit.target: Pass-through "nameidentifier" claim from Windows Live ID as "nameidentifier"

trans-unit.source: If you do not see desired identity provider, you should return to the <ui>Identity Providers</ui> page of the Management Portal and specify it.
trans-unit.target: If you do not see desired identity provider, you should return to the <ui>Identity Providers</ui> page of the Management Portal and specify it.

trans-unit.source: To add identity providers follow the steps outlined in the following How-To topics:
trans-unit.target: To add identity providers follow the steps outlined in the following How-To topics:

trans-unit.source: Step 3 – Create Pass-Through Rules
trans-unit.target: Step 3 – Create Pass-Through Rules

trans-unit.source: This step shows you how to create pass-through rules.
trans-unit.target: This step shows you how to create pass-through rules.

trans-unit.source: A pass-through rule is one where the outgoing claims are exactly the same as incoming claims.
trans-unit.target: A pass-through rule is one where the outgoing claims are exactly the same as incoming claims.

trans-unit.source: To create pass-through rules
trans-unit.target: To create pass-through rules

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Rule groups</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Rule groups</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Rule groups</ui> page, click the desired rule group, and then click <ui>Add</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Rule groups</ui> page, click the desired rule group, and then click <ui>Add</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Add Claim Rule</ui> page, specify the following attributes:
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Add Claim Rule</ui> page, specify the following attributes:

trans-unit.source: <ui>Claims issuer</ui>—Choose your desired identity provider from the drop-down list (for example, Google or Windows Live ID) or click the <ui>Access Control Service</ui> radio button.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Claims issuer</ui>—Choose your desired identity provider from the drop-down list (for example, Google or Windows Live ID) or click the <ui>Access Control Service</ui> radio button.

trans-unit.source: <ui>(And) Input claim type</ui>—Specify either <ui>Any</ui> for all incoming claims or choose a specific claim type from the drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: <ui>(And) Input claim type</ui>—Specify either <ui>Any</ui> for all incoming claims or choose a specific claim type from the drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: <ui>(And) Input claim value</ui>—Specify <ui>Any</ui> for all claims values to be passed through or specify a specific claim value in the <ui>Enter Value</ui> box to only pass through the one specified.
trans-unit.target: <ui>(And) Input claim value</ui>—Specify <ui>Any</ui> for all claims values to be passed through or specify a specific claim value in the <ui>Enter Value</ui> box to only pass through the one specified.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Output claim type</ui>—Specify a specific claim type by selecting the <ui>Pass through input claim type</ui> radio button.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Output claim type</ui>—Specify a specific claim type by selecting the <ui>Pass through input claim type</ui> radio button.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Output claim value</ui>—Specify a specific claim value by selecting the <ui>Pass through input claim value</ui> radio button.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Output claim value</ui>—Specify a specific claim value by selecting the <ui>Pass through input claim value</ui> radio button.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, (recommended) you can add a description for the rule, and then click <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, (recommended) you can add a description for the rule, and then click <ui>Save</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Step 4 – Create Advanced Transformation Rules
trans-unit.target: Step 4 – Create Advanced Transformation Rules

trans-unit.source: This step shows how to create advanced transformation rules as opposed to auto-generated and pass-through rules.
trans-unit.target: This step shows how to create advanced transformation rules as opposed to auto-generated and pass-through rules.

trans-unit.source: To create advanced transformation rules
trans-unit.target: To create advanced transformation rules

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Rule groups</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Rule groups</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Rule groups</ui> page, click the desired rule group and then click <ui>Add</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Rule groups</ui> page, click the desired rule group and then click <ui>Add</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Add Claim Rule</ui> page, specify the following attributes:
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Add Claim Rule</ui> page, specify the following attributes:

trans-unit.source: <ui>Claims issuer</ui>—Select the specific <ui>Identity Provider</ui> radio button if you want to transform claims from identity providers, such as Windows Live ID, Google, Facebook, and Yahoo!
trans-unit.target: <ui>Claims issuer</ui>—Select the specific <ui>Identity Provider</ui> radio button if you want to transform claims from identity providers, such as Windows Live ID, Google, Facebook, and Yahoo!

trans-unit.source: Select <ui>Access Control Service</ui> if you want to transform claims of service identities (in the case of Web Services) or the claims output from other rules.
trans-unit.target: Select <ui>Access Control Service</ui> if you want to transform claims of service identities (in the case of Web Services) or the claims output from other rules.

trans-unit.source: <ui>(And) Input claim type</ui>—Select the type of the claim you wish to transform from the drop-down box or if it is not listed there, enter the claim type in the <ui>Enter type</ui> text box.
trans-unit.target: <ui>(And) Input claim type</ui>—Select the type of the claim you wish to transform from the drop-down box or if it is not listed there, enter the claim type in the <ui>Enter type</ui> text box.

trans-unit.source: <ui>(And) Input claim value</ui>—Specify a specific value in the <ui>Enter value</ui> text box if you wish to transform a claim that matches this value only.
trans-unit.target: <ui>(And) Input claim value</ui>—Specify a specific value in the <ui>Enter value</ui> text box if you wish to transform a claim that matches this value only.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Output claim type</ui>—Select the type of the output claim you wish to map to the incoming claim or if it is not listed there, enter the claim type in the <ui>Enter type</ui> text box.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Output claim type</ui>—Select the type of the output claim you wish to map to the incoming claim or if it is not listed there, enter the claim type in the <ui>Enter type</ui> text box.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Output claim value</ui>—Specify a specific value in the <ui>Enter Value</ui> text box if you wish to generate a constant value in the output claim.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Output claim value</ui>—Specify a specific value in the <ui>Enter Value</ui> text box if you wish to generate a constant value in the output claim.

trans-unit.source: Step 5 – Review the Available Rule Groups
trans-unit.target: Step 5 – Review the Available Rule Groups

trans-unit.source: This step shows you how to review rule groups that contain claims transformation rules.
trans-unit.target: This step shows you how to review rule groups that contain claims transformation rules.

trans-unit.source: Rule groups are associated directly with relying party applications.
trans-unit.target: Rule groups are associated directly with relying party applications.

trans-unit.source: A rule group can be used by more than one relying party application and a relying party application can reference more than one rule group.
trans-unit.target: A rule group can be used by more than one relying party application and a relying party application can reference more than one rule group.

trans-unit.source: To review the available rule groups, follow the steps outlined previously in <link xlink:href="d0422d14-75f4-411b-aa47-4ceeccb7a33a#BKMK_2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Step 1 – Navigate to the Rule Groups Page of the Management Portal</link>.
trans-unit.target: To review the available rule groups, follow the steps outlined previously in <link xlink:href="d0422d14-75f4-411b-aa47-4ceeccb7a33a#BKMK_2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Step 1 – Navigate to the Rule Groups Page of the Management Portal</link>.

trans-unit.source: Step 6 – Configure a Relying Party to Use for Specific Rule Groups
trans-unit.target: Step 6 – Configure a Relying Party to Use for Specific Rule Groups

trans-unit.source: This step sows how to set specific rule groups for a relying party (a web application or RESTful web service).
trans-unit.target: This step sows how to set specific rule groups for a relying party (a web application or RESTful web service).

trans-unit.source: To configure a relying party to use for specific rule groups
trans-unit.target: To configure a relying party to use for specific rule groups

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Relying party applications</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Relying party applications</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Relying party applications</ui> page, click the desired relying party.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Relying party applications</ui> page, click the desired relying party.

trans-unit.source: Scroll down to the <ui>Rule Groups</ui> section, and then check all of rule groups you wish to apply for this relying party.
trans-unit.target: Scroll down to the <ui>Rule Groups</ui> section, and then check all of rule groups you wish to apply for this relying party.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Save</ui>.
